Using the Report Engine API i invoke RunAndRenderTask.run() from a scheduled job and the invocation fails because a required parameter is missing:

org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: Some required parameter values are not set or set to incompatible data type.

Now i want to store this Exception in a database in order to show information to the user, when he will look later at the result of the job execution. Trying to serialize the exception (via Hibernate) will fail with the following root cause: 

Caused by: java.io.NotSerializableException: com.ibm.icu.impl.ResourceBundleWrapper
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.defaultWriteFields(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeSerialData(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeOrdinaryObject(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject(Unknown Source)
	at org.hibernate.util.SerializationHelper.serialize(SerializationHelper.java:154)

Superclass BirtException seems to be the problem because it has a non-static field "rb" of type ResourceBundle, which references an instance of com.ibm.icu.impl.ResourceBundleWrapper.
change the ResourceBundle field to transient.
